definition: to belittle/to disparage/to play down/to demean/to degrade/to devalue
to diminish/to demote/to reduce or devaluate/to disparage/to censure/to depreciate
low/beneath/to lower (one's head)/to let droop/to hang down/to incline

sentences.english: Or have scientists been sexing up the risks and playing down the uncertainties?
sentences.chinese: 或者科学家对风险添油加醋，而贬低了不确定性？

sentences.english: She demeans herself by doing his dirty work.
sentences.chinese: 她替他干卑鄙的勾当，贬低了自己的人格。

sentences.english: And as I say,I don't in any way want to belittle the central badness of that.
sentences.chinese: 我说过我并不想贬低其主要坏处。

sentences.english: I have never been praised nor belittled; I am below no one.
sentences.chinese: 可我既没受到赞扬也没受到贬低，因为我不寄人篱下。

sentences.english: But small-minded people belittle what they don't understand.
sentences.chinese: 但是眼光狭窄的人总是贬低他们不理解的事物。

sentences.english: She depreciates all our efforts to help her.
sentences.chinese: 她贬低我们帮助她的一切努力。

sentences.english: I was very hurt when he denigrated my efforts.
sentences.chinese: 他贬低我的努力时，我的自尊心受到了伤害。

sentences.english: Sometimes parents scream, yell, and use putdowns.
sentences.chinese: 有时父母会尖叫，喊叫，和贬低。

sentences.english: Yes, some people will shriek about “debasing” the dollar.
sentences.chinese: 没错，有些人会发出“贬低”美元的喊叫。

sentences.english: He has also missed no opportunity to belittle his Republicanconfrères.
sentences.chinese: 他还不失时机地贬低他的共和党兄弟们。

sentences.english: Self-deprecation is a noble British tradition.
sentences.chinese: 自我贬低是英国一个高尚的传统。

sentences.english: There is nowhere in the article that science is denigrated or devalued, as far as I can see.
sentences.chinese: 就我看来，文中丝毫没有诋毁或贬低科学的意思。

sentences.english: Her beliefs were pilloried and belittled.
sentences.chinese: 她的信仰被大家所嘲笑和贬低。

sentences.english: So I don't demean that any more than I demean soap operas.
sentences.chinese: 所以我不贬低它，我更瞧不起肥皂剧。

sentences.english: People's prejudices can diminish them----but they cannot diminish you.
sentences.chinese: 人们的偏见可以贬低他们自己，但无法贬低你。

sentences.english: People's prejudices can diminish them----but they cannot diminish you.
sentences.chinese: 人们的偏见可以贬低他们自己，但无法贬低你。

definition: to speak sarcastically/to make cutting remarks
to defame/to libel/to defile/to smear/to vilify
to look down upon/to hold in contempt
to despise/to disdain/to look down upon
to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
